author: Raquel Coronell Uribe
description: Interim U.S. Attorney for New Jersey Alina Habba said the Democratic lawmaker was indicted on three counts of interfering with law enforcement.
title: Rep. LaMonica McIver indicted on federal charges over clash with law enforcement at ICE facility in New Jersey

author: Ken Dilanian
description: The Trump administration is planning to end a DHS terrorism prevention program that former officials and experts say has helped thwart attacks in the U.S.
title: Trump administration to end DHS program designed to thwart terror attacks

author: Brandy Zadrozny
description: The demonstration came a day after Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. gutted a federal vaccine safety panel and vowed to replace all the members.
title: CDC staff and retired workers call for Kennedy’s resignation in a protest outside headquarters

author: Phil Helsel
description: Journalist Terry Moran is out at ABC News after calling top White House official Stephen Miller a “world-class hater” whose “hatreds are his spiritual nourishment” on social media
title: ABC journalist Terry Moran out at network after social media post about Stephen Miller

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Diddy’s ex-girlfriend ‘Jane’ confirms he supported her financially

author: Zoë Richards
description: In an interview with NBC News, Tom Homan described how protests in Los Angeles have affected Immigration and Customs Enforcement operations in recent days.
title: Trump's border czar says protests are making immigration raids more ‘difficult’ and ‘dangerous’

author: The Associated Press
description: Boxing’s most-anticipated fight in years, Canelo Alvarez against Terence Crawford, will be in Las Vegas on Sept. 13 after much speculation that it would take place in Saudi Arabia.
title: Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford to fight in Las Vegas for unified super middleweight title

author: Scott Wong
description: The Republican-controlled House is poised to pass a trio of bills this week to repeal Washington, D.C., laws on immigration, voting and policing, even as it has yet to restore a painful a $1 billion cut to the city's budget.
title: House passes Republican-led bills to repeal D.C. laws on noncitizen voting and policing

author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, we explore how California Gov. Gavin Newsom is navigating a high-profile political fight with President Donald Trump.
title: A high-stakes moment for Gavin Newsom: From the Politics Desk

author: David Ingram
description: A Tesla robotaxi driving without a human driver has been spotted on the streets of Austin, according to a video posted on X and reshared by Tesla CEO Elon Musk.
title: Video shows Tesla robotaxi on the streets of Austin without a human driver

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Cary López Alvarado, who's nine months pregnant, said that after being released from immigration custody Sunday she experienced sharp stomach pains and was hospitalized.
title: A pregnant U.S. citizen went to the hospital after immigration agents detained her

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: University of Colorado football coach Deion Sanders has not attended the summer football camps due to an unspecified health issue.
title: Deion Sanders misses Colorado football camps amid unspecified health issues

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: The Department of Health and Human Services’ proposed budget for 2026 eliminates specialized suicide hotline services for LGBTQ youth and young adults.
title: White House proposes axing 988 suicide hotline services for LGBTQ youth

author: Denise Chow
description: Four crew members are set to launch Wednesday on a privately funded mission to the International Space Station
title: SpaceX readies private launch of four astronauts to International Space Station

author: Jonathan Allen
description: Amid immigration raids, peaceful protests, attacks on law enforcement officers and the threat of his own arrest by federal agents, California Gov.
title: Gavin Newsom locks horns with Trump in a politically defining moment

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump warned Tuesday that anyone who protests at the U.S. military parade here on Saturday will be met with "very heavy force."
title: Trump warns that military parade protesters will face 'very heavy force'

author: Hayden Mitman, NBC Philadelphia
description: One of two instruments stolen from the band Heart as they were set to embark on the “An Evening With Heart” tour in Atlantic City, New Jersey, has been recovered.
title: Atlantic City police recover guitar stolen from the band Heart

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: Donald Trump's move to send National Guard troops and Marines to Los Angeles amid unrest over his immigration policies has given new weight to a lingering question: How far can a president go in using the military to quell domestic disturbances?
title: Military deployment in L.A. puts Trump's authority to use troops at home in the spotlight

description: Defense attorneys questioning the ex-girlfriend of Sean "Diddy" Combs, identified only as "Jane," focused on her drug use and ongoing financial ties to the rap mogul during cross-examination.
title: Ex-girlfriend 'Jane' faces cross-examination in Sean Combs' trial

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Rapper Macklemore’s Seattle home was robbed over the weekend by masked men who attacked the nanny with bear spray, police said
title: Macklemore’s Seattle house is burglarized, nanny hit with bear spray

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: FIFA and Global Citizen announced on June 9 that J Balvin, Doja Cat and Tems will headline the inaugural halftime show of the FIFA Club World Cup final
title: J Balvin, Doja Cat and Tems to perform at the inaugural FIFA Club World Cup Final Halftime Show

author: Natasha Korecki
description: The sister of a woman allegedly murdered by six noncitizens said President Donald Trump’s administration is targeting the wrong people for deportation and is not doing enough to get the worst of the worst off U.S. streets, even as authorities embark on a massive deportation effort
title: Trump faces criticism of his broad mass deportation push from two different angles

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump travels to North Carolina to deliver remarks at Fort Bragg ahead of the Army's 250th anniversary celebration in Washington, D.C.
title: Trump delivers remarks at Fort Bragg

author: Scott Stump
description: Bryan Cranston called his daughter, 'The Pitt' star Taylor Dearden a 'wonderful, hard-working actor'
title: Bryan Cranston had the sweetest reaction to praise for daughter's work on 'The Pitt'

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Twenty four universities, including five Ivy League schools, and more than 12,000 alumni took measures to back Harvard University in its legal battle against the Trump administration, which has threatened it with slashing billions of dollars in grants
title: Harvard gets new legal backing from 5 Ivies and over 12,000 alumni

description: President Donald Trump defended his decision to call in the National Guard and said he would consider invoking the Insurrection Act to quell protesters in Los Angeles. NBC News' Camila Bernal reports on how Trump says he believed the city would be in a worse condition if not for additional law enforcement.
title: Trump defends sending in National Guard: 'Los Angeles would be burning'

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., introduced a bill to raise the federal minimum wage to $15 per hour, making him a rare congressional Republican to endorse the historically liberal cause.
title: GOP Sen. Josh Hawley introduces bill to raise federal minimum wage to $15 per hour

author: Liz Calvario
description: Sydney Sweeney was dedicated to embodying pioneering female boxer Christy Martin for an upcoming biopic
title: Sydney Sweeney discusses gaining 30 pounds for Christy Martin biopic

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: An undocumented man who faces deportation after he was framed as the author of letters threatening to kill President Donald Trump was deemed not a danger to the public during a bond hearing Tuesday
title: Man in ICE custody who was framed for writing letters threatening to kill Trump is granted bond

author: Chelsea Chan
description: Pop star Katy Perry was surprised at her concert in Sydney on Monday when a fan briefly ran up to her on stage and grabbed her before being escorted away by security.
title: 'Prankster' storms stage at Katy Perry concert in Sydney

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A California woman is suing Costco for more than $14 million after she said a liquor cabinet fell on her, leaving her with serious injuries that include a traumatic brain injury.
title: Woman sues Costco for $14M, says cabinet fell on her at California store and gave her brain injury

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: As U.S. and Chinese negotiators meet for trade talks, a primary concern for Washington will be whether Beijing eases the flow of rare earth materials.
title: How rare earth minerals could give China the upper hand in U.S. trade talks

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: Taylor Swift filed a restraining order against a 45-year-old man she says has been stalking her Los Angeles homes for almost a year and claiming to be in a relationship with her.
title: Taylor Swift files for a restraining order against an alleged stalker, says he 'makes me fear for my safety'

author: The Associated Press
description: WASHINGTON — The population of emperor penguins in one part of Antarctica appears to be declining faster than previously thought, according to a new analysis of satellite imagery released Tuesday
title: Emperor penguins show dramatic decline in one region of Antarctica, satellite photos show

author: The Associated Press
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump’s trade wars are expected to slash economic growth this year in the United States and around the world, the World Bank forecast Tuesday
title: Citing trade wars, the World Bank sharply downgrades global economic growth forecast to 2.3%

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Jamie Foxx let the tears flow while accepting the Ultimate Icon Award at the BET Awards on June 9.After being introduced by Stevie Wonder, the Oscar winner opened on a note of gratitude.“Man, we used to take this thing for granted — that God is good,” he began his speech.“I cannot even begin to express the love that I feel from everybody out there,” he continued
title: Jamie Foxx delivers heartfelt speech at BET Awards thanking daughters who helped his stroke recovery

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Country singer Conner Smith was involved in a car accident in Nashville Sunday night that left a 77-year-old woman dead, police said.
title: Country singer Conner Smith fatally strikes 77-year-old woman with his truck in crosswalk

description: During a hearing on Capitol Hill, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth was questioned about the cost and budget impacts of the National Guard and Marines being deployed to the Los Angeles protests.
title: Hegseth questioned about cost of deploying troops to Los Angeles for protests

author: The Associated Press
description: PORTLAND, Ore. — Twenty-seven states and the District of Columbia on Monday filed a lawsuit in bankruptcy court seeking to block the sale of personal genetic data by 23andMe without customer consent.
title: Dozens of states sue to block the sale of 23andMe personal genetic data without customer consent

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A woman accused of helping escaped New Orleans inmate Derrick Groves was arrested Monday amid the ongoing search for him and fellow escapee Antoine Massey.
title: Girlfriend of New Orleans fugitive Derrick Groves arrested as search continues for last 2 escapees

author: Patrick Smith
description: Dozens of protests and rallies opposing ICE raids and government immigration policies were held across the country on Monday, with more planned for the rest of the week, after a weekend of protests and unrest in Los Angeles
title: Anti-ICE protests held coast-to-coast after L.A. unrest as national movement grows

author: The Associated Press
description: Rookie center fielder Denzel Clarke made yet another spectacular catch for the Athletics, this time reaching high above the wall to rob the Los Angeles Angels' Nolan Schanuel of a home run on Monday night.
title: Watch Athletics center fielder make spectacular home run-saving catch

author: The Associated Press
description: Taking advantage of the Edmonton Oilers' worst performance in several weeks, the defending Florida Panthers pounced on mistakes to win Game 3 in a 6-1 rout Monday night and take a 2-1 series lead.
title: Panthers rout Oilers 6-1 to take a 2-1 lead in the Stanley Cup Final

description: At least nine people were killed and several others injured in a school shooting in the Austrian city of Graz on Tuesday. Police say the suspect is also dead. There is no word yet on their identity or motive.
title: At Least 9 Killed at School Shooting in Austria

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Greta Thunberg was deported from Israel on Tuesday, the Israeli Foreign Ministry said, the day after she and other activists were detained while trying to deliver a symbolic shipment of aid to Gaza by sea
title: Greta Thunberg deported from Israel after its military intercepts Gaza-bound aid boat

author: The Associated Press
description: ATMORE, Ala. — A man convicted of beating a woman to death nearly 37 years ago is scheduled to be executed Tuesday in Alabama in what will be the nation’s sixth execution with nitrogen gas
title: Alabama to execute a man for the 1988 beating death of a woman he dated

author: The Associated Press
description: A man convicted of raping and killing a woman three decades ago after kidnapping her from a supermarket parking lot in Florida is scheduled to be executed Tuesday
title: Florida set to execute man convicted of raping and killing a woman 3 decades ago

description: In the first testimony since his confirmation, the defense secretary is likely to be grilled for sharing sensitive information on Signal group chats.
title: Pete Hegseth to face Congress after a rocky few months

description: As demonstrators mark four days of clashes and protests over ICE immigration raids in Los Angeles, President Donald Trump mobilized 700 active-duty Marines to “restore order.” It comes amid growing tensions between the Trump administration and California’s leaders, with Trump suggesting he’s open to arresting California Gov. Gavin Newsom. NBC’s Liz Kreutz reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Suggests He’s Open to Arresting California Gov. Newsom

description: "Jane" has testified about "hotel nights," graphic sexual encounters that were nearly identical to what Cassie Ventura described as "freak offs."
title: Sean Combs' ex-girlfriend 'Jane' returns for cross examination

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Trump administration officials say the immigration fight with California is a political win.
title: Trump leans into L.A. protests and CDC vaccine panel fired: Morning Rundown

author: The Associated Press
description: The leaders of a sex-focused women's wellness company that promoted "orgasmic meditation" have been convicted of federal forced labor charges.
title: Leaders of 'orgasmic meditation' women's wellness company OneTaste convicted in forced labor trial

description: Video shows the moment a fan jumped on stage during a Katy Perry concert in Sydney and tried to hug the pop star before being dragged off stage by security guards. After Perry moved away from the fan, she declared “there’s never going to be show like this so just enjoy it, Sydney.”
title: Fan jumps on stage during Katy Perry concert in Australia

author: Reuters
description: Iran said Monday that it will soon hand a counter-proposal for a nuclear deal to the United States in response to a U.S. offer that Tehran deems “unacceptable.”
title: Trump says Iran nuclear talks to resume with Tehran set to offer counter-proposal

author: The Associated Press
description: The Israeli navy attacked docks in Yemen's rebel-held port city of Hodeida on Tuesday, likely damaging facilities that are key to aid shipments to the hungry, war-wracked nation.
title: Israeli navy attacks Yemen's rebel-held port city of Hodeida for first time in the conflict

author: Andrew Greif
description: The Indiana Pacers aren't a destination for the NBA's free agents and rarely earn high draft picks. To reach the Finals, they had to buck convention and get creative.
title: NBA champions are usually built the same ways. The Pacers had to be different.

author: Jocelyn Shek
description: Dog attacks on postal workers have reached a 7-year high in 2024, U.S. Postal Service data shows. Last year, dogs attacked more than 6,000 mail carriers.
title: Dog attacks on mail carriers reach 7-year high

author: Steve Kornacki
description: Rep. Mikie Sherrill heads into Tuesday’s primary as the favorite to win the Democratic nomination for governor of New Jersey.
title: Steve Kornacki: The geographic dividing lines shaping New Jersey's primary

author: Bridget Bowman
description: New Jersey voters are heading to the polls on Tuesday to pick nominees for this year’s race for governor, in the first high-profile primaries for both parties since the 2024 election.
title: The Trump test, Democrats' future and big money: Three things to watch in New Jersey's primaries

author: Stella Kim
description: Two members of the K-pop sensation BTS, RM and V, completed their mandatory 18-month military service in South Korea on Tuesday, leaving their base to the roars of fans counting down for the supergroup’s reunion.
title: BTS members RM and V complete mandatory military service as K-pop group nears full reunion

author: Tom Winter
description: U.S. authorities said Monday that they had arrested a Chinese researcher accused of smuggling biological material into the country, the second such case in days
title: U.S. says it has arrested another Chinese researcher accused of smuggling biological material

author: Matt Dixon
description: President Donald Trump’s immigration agenda has met a groundswell of opposition in Los Angeles, the country’s second-largest city.
title: 'We're happy to have this fight': Trump administration leans into California protests

description: During a press conference, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass demanded the federal government stop conducting immigration raids in the city. She suggested that Los Angeles may be "a test case for what happens when the federal government moves in and takes the authority away from the state, or away from local government."
title: L.A. mayor suggests city may be a 'test case' for increased federal authority

description: NBC News’ Gadi Schwartz reports from the anti-ICE protests in Los Angeles where authorities are working to disperse crowds. Officials fired tear gas and flash-bangs to move the demonstrators.
title: Reporter falls back with dispersed L.A. protesters amid flash-bangs, tear gas

author: Tyler Kingkade
description: Trump's escalation of immigration arrests by shifting into workplaces ignited clashes between protesters and officers in the immigrant-heavy city.
title: How immigration raids at Ambiance Apparel and Home Depot led to the Los Angeles protests
